meaning_str.bing:
adv. 不同；不同地；不以为然地；别具一格
网络. 不同的；尝试另一种不同；有区别的

不同；不同地；不以为然地；别具一格
不同的；尝试另一种不同；有区别的

1.en: 'If it was win at all costs, there would be other things we would do differently, ' he said.
1.cn: 他说，如果为保持第一而不计代价，那我们就会是另外一种做法了。

2.en: I wondered if I could have done something differently or what else might have happened with some one that crazy.
2.cn: 我很好奇如果我能做些与众不同的事情或者说，遇上了其他类似如斯疯狂的人的所作所为我能做点别的事情会如何。

3.en: My sense tells me that he might begin to see thing a little differently from then on .
3.cn: 我的直觉告诉我他可能开始从那时起开始看事情有一点点不同。

1.en: Why? Would you have chosen differently? Out of fear?
1.cn: 为什么？因为这个你就会选别的派系吗？是因为恐惧吗？

2.en: We have to look at the competition and say we're gonna do it differently.
2.cn: 我们会对竞争对手说，我们还可以做出不同的东西来

3.en: Okay, he was talking about rules. Uh-huh. And looking at people differently.
3.cn: 他说到规则，对别人有不同的看法。

4.en: What if there was something in his blood that made him act differently that day?
4.cn: 也许当时他行为举止异常是因为他血液里被人注射了药物

5.en: No. But it's a shame our society mocks the differently uvulated. Who was at the door?
5.cn: 不想，但我们社会嘲笑奇异舌头的做法是可耻的。刚才谁敲门了？

6.en: Look, you don't have to do anything differently. Just be yourself. You're gay enough.
6.cn: 你没必要改变自己的行为，做自己就好，你就很基佬了。

7.en: While some are creative but not reliable, others are reliable but not creative, and so on. Because of how are brains are wired differently, everyone perceives the world around them differently.
7.cn: 有的人有创意但不可靠，其他人可靠但没创意等等。因为我们思维方式的不同，看待周围世界的方式也不一样。

8.en: So you're dressing differently. You're taking dresses from my closet. You said I could.
8.cn: 所以你的穿着打扮变了，你从我的衣柜里拿裙子穿。你自己同意的。

9.en: I don't need any protein. I feel like the universe is telling you differently. Who did that?!
9.cn: 我不需要蛋白质。可是老天爷好像想你补充“蛋白质”呢。是谁干的？！

10.en: Wait. The premise is that he is dressed differently? Yeah. That's true. He is not dressed the same.
10.cn: 等等，哏都是在嘲讽他打扮跟平常不一样吗？对啊。的确啊。是跟平常差很多。

11.en: Wait a minute. He stopped talking the minute Phoebe came in. Because he was looking at her differently.
11.cn: 等一下，菲比走进来时，他就不说了。因为他用不同的眼光看她。

12.en: Leaving your family? Si. But I could not have done it differently. One cannot deny who one is meant to be.
12.cn: 离开家人？对，但如果时光倒流我还是会做出同样的选择，天命难违。

13.en: It offers us free. It's space by itself. It's a category by itself and we think about it very differently.
13.cn: 我们得到免费的价格，它可以自由发挥，它不属于任何分类，我们要用不同的眼光看它。

14.en: Those things feel very differently and even though you can tell yourself all kind of stories about pencils.
14.cn: 这两件事情给人的感觉很不一样，你拿走一个铅笔，可以给自己编造各种各样的理由。

15.en: Let's say that it is him. Would we not want the baby? No. Would we treat him any differently? I'd keep an eye on him.
15.cn: 好了，好了，就算是他。我们就不要这孩子了？不，我们会对他另眼相待吗？我会一直提防着他的！

16.en: Okay. So you, me and London. Looking at people differently. Maybe he wants to do what you and I did in London with someone.
16.cn: 好吧，你跟我在伦敦对别人有不同的看法，或许他想跟某人发生你跟我在伦敦发生的事。

17.en: And the good news is that he'll be smarter because he'll be in college. And he just may be smart enough to look at you differently.
17.cn: 好消息是他到时会聪明点，因为他在上大学。他或许会聪明到用不同的眼光看你。

18.en: When you get compliments from people who don't ordinarily compliment you, when people look at you differently, packaging does matter.
18.cn: 当你从平常并不赞赏你的人口中获得表扬的时候，当人们用不一样的眼光看待你的时候，外表的确很重要。

19.en: That's when I realized that the best way to go through the jungle of life is with insightful people who see things differently from me.
19.cn: 那时候我意识到穿过生命丛林的最好方法是与智慧的人携手，用不同的眼光看问题。
